sources.title: I Bury The Living (1958)
sources.description: From IMDB: A newly appointed cemetary chairman discovers that, merely by inserting a black pin into a wall-sized map of the cemetary, he can cause the death of the plot's owner. Richard Boone stars.

sources.title: I Bury the Living
sources.description: Title: I Bury the Living Summary: Cemetery director Robert Kraft discovers that by arbitrarily changing the status of plots from empty to occupied on the planogram causes the death of the plots' owners. Directed by: Albert Band Actors: Richard Boone, Theodore Bikel, Peggy Maurer Production Company: Maxim Productions Release Date: July 1958 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.85 : 1 Through a series of macabre "coincidences," the newly-elected director of a cemetery (Richard Boone) begins to believe that he can cause the deaths of living owners of burial plots by merely changing the push-pin color from white (living) to black (dead) on a large wall map of the cemetery that notes those plots.

sources.title: I Bury the Living (1958)
sources.description: The new manager of a small-town cemetery becomes convinced that he triggered the untimely deaths of several plot owners by tampering with a certain map. When nobody believes him, he risks his sanity to play God once again and prove his point. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/i-bury-the-living-1958/

metadata.Plot: Through a series of macabre "coincidences," the newly-elected director of a cemetery (Richard Boone) begins to believe that he can cause the deaths of living owners of burial plots by merely changing the push-pin color from white (living) to black (dead) on a large wall map of the cemetery that notes those plots.
metadata.Actors: Richard Boone, Theodore Bikel, Peggy Maurer
